metadata.title: CVE-2021-41159 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP),released under the Apache license. All FreeRDP clients prior to version2.4.1 using gateway connections (`/gt:rpc`) fail to validate input data. Amalicious gateway might allow client memory to be written out of bounds.This issue has been resolved in version 2.4.1. If you are unable to updatethen use `/gt:http` rather than /gt:rdp connections if possible or use adirect connection without a gateway.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
freerdp2-wayland - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
freerdp2-x11 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libuwac0-0 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
libwinpr2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
winpr-utils - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu2').
